documentation: The exact timestamp of the data snapshot. Essential for historical analysis. Data Type: timestamp.
The number of shares held. Data Type: numeric.
The total market value of the positions at that datetime. Data Type: numeric.
Year-To-Date unrealized (on paper) profit or loss. Data Type: numeric.
Timestamp when the record was created. Data Type: timestamp.
Timestamp when the record was last updated. Data Type: timestamp.
A more granular timestamp of the last modification. Data Type: timestamp.
The date for which the P&L data is recorded. Data Type: timestamp.
The name of the investment portfolio. Data Type: character varying.
The stock ticker symbol. Data Type: character varying.
Number of shares held. Data Type: numeric.
Total market value of the holding. Data Type: numeric.
Year-To-Date unrealized (paper) profit or loss. Data Type: numeric.
Year-To-Date realized (locked-in) profit or loss from sold positions. Data Type: numeric.
The sum of realized and unrealized P&L for the year. Best metric for overall profitability. Data Type: numeric.
Timestamp when this record was created. Data Type: timestamp.
Profit or loss realized on this specific day. Data Type: numeric.
The date for which the summary is calculated. Use MAX(datetime) to get the latest data. Data Type: timestamp.
The unique name of the investment portfolio. Data Type: character varying.
The total current value of the portfolio (cash + holdings). Data Type: numeric.
The Year-To-Date return of the portfolio as a percentage. Data Type: numeric.
The total return of the portfolio since its inception as a percentage. Data Type: numeric.
The total profit of the portfolio since its inception in absolute monetary terms. Data Type: numeric.
The total capital allocated to this portfolio. Data Type: numeric.
The Month-To-Date return as a percentage. Data Type: numeric.
The Quarter-To-Date return as a percentage. Data Type: numeric.
The daily return as a percentage. Data Type: numeric.

The amount of the allocated capital that is currently invested. 
    **Hint**: To find 'funds available for new investments' or 'unutilized capital', you must calculate the difference: (`allocated_amount` - `utilized_amount`).
    Data Type: numeric.

A category the portfolio belongs to (e.g., 'Balanced', 'Aggressive').
    **Hint**: To compare performance across groups, you should GROUP BY this column and calculate aggregate metrics like AVG(ytd_return), SUM(ytd_profit), and COUNT(portfolio_name).
    Data Type: character varying.

The precise timestamp of the last data update for the portfolio summary.
    **CRITICAL**: This column is named `last_updated_time`. When asked for the 'last update' or 'latest update time', you MUST use this column. 
    Do NOT use `last_updated` or `updated_at` for this table.
    Data Type: timestamp without time zone.

The total capital allocated to this portfolio. 
    **CRITICAL**: When asked for 'total investment amount' or 'total capital allocated', you MUST use this column. 
    The column name is `allocated_amount`. Do NOT use `total_capital_allocated`.
    Data Type: numeric.

This column contains a text description of the portfolio's strategy.
    **CRITICAL**: The column name is `portfolio_description`. 
    When asked for a portfolio's 'description' or 'strategy', you MUST use this column. 
    Do NOT use a column named `strategy`.
    Data Type: character varying.

The total return of the portfolio since its inception, as a percentage.
    **CRITICAL**: This column is named `all_return`. When a user asks for 'total return', 'all-time return', or 'return since inception', you MUST use the `all_return` column.
    Do NOT use a column named `total_return`.
    Data Type: numeric.

The inception date of the portfolio (when it was created).
    **CRITICAL**: This column is named `portfolio_startdate`. When asked about 'new portfolios', their 'inception date', or 'creation date', you MUST use this column.
    Do NOT use a column named `inception_date`.
    Data Type: date.

The cost basis accounting method used (e.g., 'FIFO').
    **CRITICAL**: This column is named `cost_model`. When asked about the 'cost model', 'cost basis', or 'accounting method', you MUST use this column.
    Do NOT use a column named `cost_basis_method`.
    Data Type: character varying.
